intro: Campanula ochroleuca, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Campanula ochroleuca prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows.
